The marimba is a percussion instrument consisting of a set of wooden bars struck 
with mallets to produce musical tones. Resonators suspended underneath the 
bars amplify their sound. The bars are arranged like the keys of a piano, with the 
groups of 2 and 3 ... Marimba is now the national instrument of Guatemala.
